data: {"title":"Man Utd: Ed Sheeran sorry for interrupting Ruben Amorim interview","description":"Ed Sheeran apologises for interrupting Manchester United manager Ruben Amorim's live pitchside TV interview after Sunday's draw at Ipswich Town.","url":"https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/articles/cyv7zgj0l52o","content":"Man Utd: Ed Sheeran sorry for interrupting Ruben Amorim interview - BBC Sport
===============
  

![Image 1: Ed Sheeran at Ipswich Town ](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/3840/cpsprodpb/551d/live/b20d9400-ab37-11ef-8d14-b38ce06af7f3.jpg)Image source, PA Media

Image caption,

Ed Sheeran has won four Brit Awards and seven Grammys

*   Published
    
    25 November 2024
    

**Ed Sheeran has apologised for interrupting Manchester United manager Ruben Amorim's live TV interview after Sunday's 1-1 Premier League draw at Ipswich Town.**

Amorim, taking charge of United for the first time, was being interviewed by Sky Sports presenter Kelly Cates, ex-United captain Roy Keane, former Manchester City midfielder Izzy Christiansen and ex-Liverpool midfielder Jamie Redknapp at Portman Road.

Singer-songwriter Sheeran, who is a minority owner at Ipswich, interrupted the pitchside interview to greet Redknapp.

Referring to Amorim, Sheeran said: "I don't think he wants to speak to me." He added: "I love being back in the Premier League."

He then left and the interview resumed.

In a post in Instagram on Monday, Sheeran wrote: "Apologies if I offended Amorim yesterday. Didn't actually realise he was being interviewed at the time. Was popping to say hi and bye to Jamie. Great game, congrats on all involved."

Sheeran became Ipswich's main shirt sponsor in 2021.

After Ipswich earned back-to-back promotions to secure a return to the Premier League this season, he [bought a minority stake](https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/articles/c75ndlv47p7o) in the club this summer.

Marcus Rashford opened the scoring for United in the second minute but Omari Hutchinson's 43rd-minute equaliser earned Ipswich a point.

1.  When Marcus Rashford scored within the first two minutes of Ruben Amorim's Manchester United era beginning, it had many fans wondering just what might be possible.
    
    But they were brought back down to earth by [Ipswich](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/teams/ipswich-town) winger Omari Hutchinson's strike before half-time.
    
    And in the latest episode of BBC Radio Manchester's The Devils' Advocate podcast, the team have been deciding what to make of the new boss' first game in charge.
    
    Media caption,
    
    [Listen to the full episode on BBC Sounds](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sounds/play/p0k6swr7)

4.  ![Image 23: The Devils' Advocate podcast graphic](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/01d2/live/6e70c820-3aa3-11ef-a044-9d4367d5b599.jpg.webp)
    
    Ruben Amorim's first game in charge of Manchester United ended in a 1-1 draw against Ipswich Town and the latest episode of BBC Radio Manchester's The Devils' Advocate has landed to unpick it all.
    
    In this week's show, Gaz Drinkwater and Joe McGrath look at who stood out at Portman Road and discuss how United's players took to the new system.
    
    [Listen to the full episode on BBC Sounds](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sounds/play/p0k6swr7)
    
    ![Image 24: Listen on BBC Sounds banner](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/2e39/live/e93a4330-3aa1-11ef-bbe0-29f79e992ddd.jpg.webp)
    
5.  ![Image 25: Chief football writer Phil McNulty byline banner](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/55a5/live/13026c10-3aa7-11ef-bbe0-29f79e992ddd.jpg.webp)
    
    ![Image 26: Manchester United's Portuguese head coach Ruben Amorim (L) shakes hands with Manchester United's Cameroonian goalkeeper #24 Andre Onana (R) at the end of the English Premier League football match between Ipswich Town and Manchester United at Portman Road](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/e00e/live/579abfe0-ab44-11ef-8ab9-9192db313061.jpg.webp)Image source, Getty Images
    
    **BBC Sport's chief football writer Phil McNulty has been answering your questions.**
    
    **Mike asked:** Manchester United may 'only' be six points off fourth place, but there are a lot of teams in between. Clearly not all teams above are going to drop more points than United do. I feel we should stop focusing on fourth place and focus on improvement for next season. Where we finish is where we finish.
    
    I don't know if it is instant gratification or a lack of knowledge among many fans, but (tell me if I am wrong) a new coach does not simply say: 'Now we set up like this, you play this position and problem solved'. It takes a lot of time and practice to replace old ways and habits with new ones.
    
    I say we need to be patient and judge it in the new season. What is your take on whether Manchester United are likely to improve?
    
    **Phil answered:** These are all very good points and Ruben Amorim made a lot of them himself after the draw at Ipswich Town, when he pointed out that Manchester United will have to "suffer" while he implements his tactical tweaks, saying it was worth risking things tactically now to feel the benefit next season.
    
    So yes, patience will be needed and, in my experience, Manchester United fans are remarkably patient with their managers.
    
    What we have seen from Amorim already is a clear identity in terms of how he wants to play and a clear idea of his strategy. I don't think we ever really saw that from Erik ten Hag.
    
    I think United will improve – and I wouldn't write off fourth place either, because I really believe that slot is wide open – but it will take time and patience, and there will be bumps along the way.
    
6.  [### 14:26 25 NovemberSheeran sorry for interrupting Amorim interview, published at 14:26 25 NovemberSheeran sorry for interrupting Amorim interview](https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/articles/cyv7zgj0l52o)
    
    *   Attribution
        
        [Premier League](https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/premier-league)
        
    
    ![Image 27: Ed Sheeran at Ipswich Town ](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/480/cpsprodpb/551d/live/b20d9400-ab37-11ef-8d14-b38ce06af7f3.jpg)
    
7.  ![Image 29: Ruben Amorim crouches on touchline during match](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/91ba/live/8b2c9540-ab21-11ef-8487-d5a0de19ffaf.jpg.webp)Image source, Getty Images
    
    Manchester United's new formation may have to "evolve into something else" if they are going to being competitive in the Premier League, says former [Liverpool](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/teams/liverpool) midfielder Danny Murphy.
    
    New boss Ruben Amorim used his favoured formation of three at the back in his first game in charge against [Ipswich](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/teams/ipswich-town) on Sunday.
    
    It was an unfamiliar set-up for the backline and, despite United taking an early lead within two minutes, they ultimately drew 1-1 against the newly promoted side.
    
    "I would be amazed if they are still playing a 3-4-3 in a year's time," Murphy said on Match of the Day 2.
    
    "This league is very, very different than continental leagues. We have only had [Chelsea](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/teams/chelsea) in recent years win playing that system. And, let's be honest, they had Kante and Matic - two wonderful midfielders in the middle of the pitch, plus Costa up top with Hazard supporting him and helping them as well.
    
    "They \[Manchester United\] don't have those players yet and how do you find them? It costs hundreds of millions to get the best players in the world.
    
    "When you play three at the back against the majority of good teams in our league who play three high, you end up being a five and that is really difficult.
    
    "If Manchester United are going to become much better and be competitive, I think that 3-4-3 will evolve into something else."
    
    [Watch the full discussion on BBC iPlayer](https://www.bbc.co.uk/iplayer/episode/m0025f6r/match-of-the-day-2-202425-24112024)
    
8.  ![Image 30: Your views banner](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/2f7f/live/95709000-0915-11ef-bee9-6125e244a4cd.jpg.webp)
    
    ![Image 31: Luke Shaw of Manchester United battles for possession with Omari Hutchinson of Ipswich Town](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/39c4/live/f4a5c660-aaa7-11ef-821d-af5442865c2a.jpg.webp)Image source, Getty Images
    
    We asked for your thoughts after Sunday's Premier League game between Ipswich Town and Manchester United, which ended in a 1-1 draw.
    
    Here are some of your comments:
    
    **Ipswich towns**
    
    **Matt**: I thought we looked like a proper Premier League team. We were better than Manchester United. This line-up is definitely our strongest 11 (apart from the absent Greaves). If we continue to play like this we will stay up. Omari was outstanding.
    
    **James**: This was another step in the right direction for Town, with a fully deserved point. It was frustrating to concede so early, as we were the team in the ascendancy in the first half, which was capped by a superb goal by Omari Hutchinson. There wasn't much between the two sides in the second half and we again showed our resilience to see out the draw.
    
    **Michael**: Wonderful performance by Town after what some would say is our regular early mistake. We battled well and had we won the game it would not have been an injustice. Credit should also go to the referee, Anthony Taylor, who allowed the game to flow and kept control throughout.
    
    **Phillip**: We more than matched a top team in the Premier League/ Europe. We probably should have got all three points. We have to believe in this fantastic team of ours because we were brilliant, as we were at T[ottenham](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/teams/tottenham-hotspur). We are building something special. Kieran McKenna, what can I say, amazing achievement. Absolutely buzzing.
    
    **United fans**
    
    **Mike58**: Obviously disappointed not to win but a draw was the least Ipswich deserved. Signs of life to come - a manager/coach with tactical knowledge and an identity. He will improve these players, for sure. Having had only days to work with these players he has overachieved. Onana clear player of the match for United.
    
    **Mark**: Early days but the same old problems resurfaced and we need to stop giving the ball away cheaply. We bossed the second half and deserved the win, but the cutting edge is still missing up front and we should be more clinical. Hopefully Amorin will iron these problems out and we will improve - slowly but steadily.
    
    **Toni**: Wasn't expecting miracles, to be honest. Amorim has a lot of work to do. However, some players can be moved on in January. We cannot and must not have a squad of uninterested professionals. A draw was good enough but we need more effort.
    
    **Davos**: A steady start for Amorim. He has plenty of work to do to get the boys firing on all cylinders. The midfield seemed a little slow at times and we just need a striker to be in the box for when the ball is played into that area as both Zirkzee and Hojlund look lost. Onwards and upwards.
    
    ![Image 32: An image detailing how to follow your Premier League team on BBC Sport: "On the app? Tap the bell icon to get news about your club sent to you. Signed in on a browser? Hit 'Follow' to stay up to date.](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/51a6/live/913754d0-476b-11ef-96a8-e710c6bfc866.jpg.webp)
    
9.  **Simon Stone**  
    Chief football news reporter
    
    ![Image 33: Monday's news paper back pages](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/0916/live/73b44a40-ab0b-11ef-bdf5-b7cb2fa86e10.jpg.webp)Image source, Mirror and Star
    
    Image caption,
    
    Monday's papers focus on Amorim's view his players will "suffer" in order to progress
    
    Ruben Amorim asked Manchester United's hierarchy if he could join the club in the summer rather than in mid-season.
    
    United said no.
    
    It is different owners calling the shots at Old Trafford now but their memories wouldn't have to be long to recall the issues created by Ralf Rangnick's ill-fated stint as interim.
    
    Their reasoning for wanting Amorim now are sound.
    
    Similarly, Amorim is one of the most highly rated young coaches in Europe. United chief executive Omar Berrada is a big fan. Going after him also made sense.
    
    The problem is having made the calls, United are now in a position where the new coach is trying to implement a new playing style, knowing there are too many midweek matches looming to allow proper training on shape and positioning, which may lead to unexpected defeats.
    
    As a club, they cannot afford to just toss away seasons as part of a big rebuild. That is not the idea behind bringing someone in like Amorim.
    
    But, at best, it is a calculated gamble.
    
    United dropped two points at Portman Road. They remain in the bottom half of the table. That situation needs to change.
    
    ![Image 34: Monday's newspaper back pages](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/8ea9/live/578e53b0-ab0b-11ef-a4fe-a3e9a6c5d640.jpg.webp)Image source, Daily Express and Guardian
    
10.  ![Image 35: Ruben Amorim ](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/1b47/live/36ed8ac0-ab08-11ef-b429-5b139d1e7a7e.jpg.webp)Image source, Getty Images
    
    Former Premier League striker Glenn Murray is confident that Manchester United's performances under Ruben Amorim "will only get better" but believes the new boss will be working on the fitness of his players.
    
    Amorim kicked-off his tenure on Sunday with a draw at [Ipswich Town](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/teams/ipswich-town), leaving United 12th in the Premier League.
    
    "Anyone at Manchester United should be good enough to fall into a different system under any manager," said Murray on the BBC Radio 5 Live Football Daily podcast. "I am glad that he lined the team-up in the way he wanted as 3-4-3 is his identity and I am sure it will only get better.
    
    "One thing I noticed is that he is not happy with their physicality. He wants them to be fitter."
    
    Despite their fast start, with Marcus Rashford scoring after just 81 seconds, United soon settled into a familiar pattern and found themselves exposed far too easily when Ipswich countered.
    
    "Amorim will be looking at this group of players and already thinking that some of them will not be here in a few months time," added former Premier League midfielder Don Hutchison. "He knows he will need to move a lot of these players on.
    
    "But you can understand and see what he wants to do in the future."

18.  ![Image 51: Ruben Amorim, Head Coach of Manchester United, interacts with Alejandro Garnacho](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/4e6a/live/8f8c1d10-aa98-11ef-a1c0-573b01005cc8.jpg.webp)Image source, Getty Images
    
    **Manchester United boss Ruben Amorim, speaking to BBC Sport**: "Not a good result but it is a tough league with high intensity. We started very well but should have had more of the ball. But we are learning."
    
    **On adapting to his formation**: "It was really hard for them, they were thinking what to do, it was not fluid which is normal after just two training sessions but they tried hard. They have so much space to improve. But after a draw you never feel the good things. So I am really happy because they tried but they can do so much better."
    
    **On the early goal**: "We worked on that but they have the talent to do it, and then it is all about the players."
    
    **On Noussair Mazraoui**: "We don't have too many centre-backs so we have to adapt some players. I thought Noussair Mazraoui did very well. He is so smart and is so important for us. He can play anywhere and that kind of player is crucial for our future."
    
    **On his first taste of the Premier League**: "It is a great environment, a great spectacle. But when the game starts it is like I am back in Portugal or the third division. I am so focused everything is the same. You guys are so lucky to have the best league in the world. I am really happy to be here but today I don't feel much because I like to win games."
    
19.  ![Image 52: Manchester United's Portuguese head coach Ruben Amorim shouts to his players](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/012f/live/e1ae36a0-aa93-11ef-ae17-6d95a5d1f2ff.jpg.webp)Image source, Getty Images
    
    Ruben Amorim became only the second permanent manager in Premier League history to see his side score within the opening two minutes of his very first game in charge, along with David Moyes with [Everton](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/teams/everton) in March 2002.
    
    However, this was just the second time Manchester United have scored inside the opening two minutes of a Premier League game and failed to win, also drawing 2-2 with [Liverpool](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/teams/liverpool) in October 1995 and losing 1-6 to [Tottenham](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/teams/tottenham-hotspur) in October 2020.

21.  ![Image 54: Chris Sutton and Peter Hooton](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/47c7/live/bfba0f40-a8ba-11ef-bdf5-b7cb2fa86e10.png.webp)
    
    Chris Sutton is making predictions for all 380 Premier League games this season, against a variety of guests.
    
    For week 12 he takes on The Farm singer and [Liverpool](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/teams/liverpool) fan Peter Hooton.
    
    The Farm's new single, Forever & Ever, is out now and their new album, Let The Music (Take Control), is released in May 2025.
    
    **Sutton's prediction: 1-1**
    
    I am guessing this is Ruben Amorim's first visit to Ipswich and it is not the ideal place for him to get started with Manchester United.
    
    Ipswich's win at [Tottenham](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/teams/tottenham-hotspur) will give them real belief and they have had three draws already at home, so they will be competitive, especially if United are adapting to a new system - a lot of their players are coming back from international duty and have not had time to work with Amorim.
    
    United will have some defending to do because Sammie Szmodics is lively up front and Liam Delap is a handful too - his stats for goal involvements, including assists, is really impressive. Ipswich just need to stop being so careless defensively. If they do that, they could get something from this game.
    
    Everyone else is probably going to put Amorim to start with a win, but I am going for a draw.
    
    After all the excitement and the hype about the apparent upgrade, then it is unthinkable for United to lose to the Tractor Boys, but imagine if they do drop points?
    
    **Hooton’s prediction: 1-2**
    
    Ipswich got a great result against Spurs but with this being Amorim’s first game, his players are going to be trying to impress him, so I can only see a United win.
    
    Obviously I hope they don't get back to what they were under Sir Alex Ferguson, but wouldn't it be great to have four or five clubs challenging for the title? That would be unbelievable. I am quite happy that United have fallen off a cliff since Ferguson left but, in a way, you want them back so you can win the league ahead of a strong United side.
    
    [Read the full predictions and have your say here](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/articles/cjdlp5kv4dgo)

24.  ![Image 59: Ruben Amorim and Joe Mourinho](https://ichef.bbci.co.uk/ace/standard/640/cpsprodpb/7035/live/5869d840-a8ea-11ef-a4fe-a3e9a6c5d640.png.webp)Image source, Getty Images
    
    Ruben Amorim has often been compared to Jose Mourinho given his nationality and success in Portugal, but the new Manchester United boss was keen to play down comparisons when he met the British media on Friday.
    
    Mourinho spent two-and-a-half-years at Old Trafford, winning the League Cup and Europa League following his appointment in 2016. He also sent compatriot Amorim a message to congratulate him on his appointment as successor to Erik ten Hag at United.
    
    "I remember that time," said Amorim, referring to when Mourinho joined [Chelsea](https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/teams/chelsea) in 2004 after winning the Champions League with Porto. "You looked at Mourinho and felt he could win everywhere. It's not the same thing. I'm different to Mourinho. He was European champion, I am not.
    
    "Football is different nowadays, I think I am the right person for this moment. I am a young guy and I try to use this to help my players.
    
    "Their young guys were \[Frank\] Lampard and these kind of players. Nowadays it's so much different. I think I'm the right person for now."","usage":{"tokens":9116}}

Ruben Amorim's first Man United setback is a blessing as new reality laid bare
==============================================================================

Ruben Amorim will be hoping that expectations have slightly dampened at Manchester United after a disappointing draw away at Ipswich Town in his first game
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

By

[Isaac Seelochan](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/isaac-seelochan/)Senior Sport Central Audience Writer

*   07:27, 26 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Manchester United head coach Ruben Amorim looks on](https://i2-prod.coventrytelegraph.net/incoming/article30450629.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_Ipswich-Town-v-Manchester-United-Premier-League-Portman-Road.jpg)

Ruben Amorim faces a huge challenge to turn Manchester United around after a decade of struggle (Image: PA)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

The script was written for [Ruben Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) and Manchester United after [Marcus Rashford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/marcus-rashford) put them 1-0 up after 90 seconds against Ipswich on Sunday.

A brave new era under an up-and-coming head coach would set them on the path to glory. [United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) were back.

Of course, those expectations would have dampened less than 45 minutes later when Omari Hutchinson curled in a deserved equaliser for [Kieran McKenna's](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/kieran-mckenna) team just before half-time. Amorim would have gone into the dressing room knowing his side needed major improvements to get all three points.

**READ MORE: [Ed Sheeran breaks silence on Ruben Amorim exchange after Man United backlash](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ed-sheeran-breaks-silence-ruben-30446892)**

**READ MORE: [Man United news LIVE: £50m transfer talk 'intensifies' as Van Nistelrooy update emerges](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/man-united-transfer-news-live-30442382)**

Those improvements never came and [it ended up being a rather disappointing 1-1 draw against relegation strugglers](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/live-manchester-united-ipswich-score-30419615). But that may not be a bad thing.

If anyone was under any illusions over how much work Amorim needs to do if United are to challenge, they got it at Portman Road. There is no quick fix at [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford) and the new Portuguese boss will be well aware of that.

Obviously, a convincing win would have been great but it may suit Amorim that excitement has slightly dampened. The fact that no one is getting carried away will allow United to focus on improving.

There have been too many false dawns over the past decade. Bright starts under previous managers have led many to believe that United are on the road back to glory.

But a reality check away at a team who sit in the relegation zone will serve notice to the fact that there's a long road back. Yes, Amorim has only had a few days to work with the majority of his squad after the international break.

It should also be noted that there are several players still not fully fit [such as Leny Yoro](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/ruben-amorim-could-soon-add-30449842), or just coming back from long layoffs like [Luke Shaw](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/luke-shaw). And yet, it was a result entirely in keeping with what most have come to expect when watching the Reds play.

This is a group of individuals who are far from being a well-oiled, winning machine. No manager can fix that after just a few days. Amorim will hope that expectation levels have dropped and he can now focus on the long road to getting United back to the top again.

Geovany Quenda could be on his way to Manchester with both United and City believed to be keen (Image: Carlos Rodrigues/Getty Images)

Hello and welcome to our Manchester United live blog on Tuesday, November 26.

Last weekend, Ruben Amorim's tenure at United started with a 1-1 draw at Ipswich Town. After the game, the Portuguese manager emphasised that some problems will take a while to get fixed.

They did get to the best start possible within 80 seconds through Marcus Rashford, who scored the opener. But [United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) later struggled to maintain a concerted presence in the final third.

The result means they have yet to score more than one goal in a Premier League game away from home since September 14. The point took them up a place to 12th in the table, having won only a third of their 12 league matches so far.

With the January transfer window just around the corner, [Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) may have a limited budget to spend after a heavy spending in the summer. However, Amorim has vowed not to buy any of his former players at Sporting CP in the new year, meaning moves for Viktor Gyokeres and [interest Geovany Quenda](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/transfer-news/geovany-quenda-transfer-latest-man-30420012) are out of the question.

With that said, MEN Sport will keep you covered with the transfer latest throughout the day. So stay up to date with all of the latest Manchester United news in our live blog below.

08:24Bruna Reis

### Kobbie Mainoo theory

Danny Murphy has suggested that Kobbie Mainoo could have no future at Manchester United following the arrival of Ruben Amorim.

Mainoo returned to the matchday squad for Ipswich Town but wasn't among the five substitutes brought on by Amorim. Manuel Ugarte meanwhile, featured off the bench after reuniting with Amorim.

Murphy believes Amorim's long-term vision for the midfield double pivot in his 3-4-3 system will involve Ugarte and a new signing.

> "To play that role well, United's midfielders will need to be more than just mobile, too," he told BBC Sport. "They will both have to love the defensive side of the game and be able to spot danger and then be fast enough to stop it. In the long run, I think Manuel Ugarte will be one of them.

> "He needs a run of games to get his sharpness back, but we have seen glimpses of how good he is, for example, in the Europa League against Fenerbahce last month, and he has flourished under Amorim at Sporting before.
> 
> "As for who Ugarte will have alongside him, well, it will probably be someone who is not at the club at the moment. There is going to have to be activity in the next couple of transfer windows for them to get the type of player Amorim requires."

20:30Isaac Seelochan

### Dalot reveals Amorim instructions

The majority of Manchester United's players are reluctant to speak in the mixed zone - the area where journalists patiently wait - and asking each player whether they had a quick two minutes as they left Portman Road was looking like a futile task after the 1-1 draw with Ipswich Town.

Each member of the squad walked past to exit the stadium and they all declined to speak, but then [Diogo Dalot](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/diogo-dalot) emerged from the dressing room by the side of a press officer.

Interactions with players in the mixed zone are brief but you get a handle on their different personalities by how they respond. Dalot is hugely popular with ordinary staff at Carrington and has the same respect from journalists for answering questions when he doesn't have to.

It takes just a few minutes for a player to provide fans with insight by speaking in the mixed zone and Dalot gets it. "We obviously didn't have a lot of days to put it all together," said Dalot when he was asked about Ruben Amorim and playing in the new head coach's formation.

### McKenna praises Amorim tactical change

Kieran McKenna admitted Ipswich Town were challenged by Ruben Amorim's tactical changes at [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc).

Amorim's success as a head coach has been underpinned by his 3-4-3 formation and he had limited time training at Carrington to prepare the players to face Ipswich at Portman Road.

The 39-year-old had just two training sessions with the full group after the international break and has warned United will have to "suffer" before his new system will be successful.

But there were some positives to take from Sunday's 1-1 draw with Ipswich. United made the perfect start to the game when taking the lead through Marcus Rashford after just 80 seconds and Amorim's system caused problems for McKenna's side in the opening exchanges.

### Ruud next job stance

Former [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) striker and coach [Ruud van Nistelrooy](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruud-van-nistelrooy) is reportedly ready to immediately step into a head coach role after his exit from the club and has already been linked to two vacant jobs.

After re-joining the club as assistant manager in the summer, the Dutchman left [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford) following the arrival of [Ruben Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) as head coach. He took charge of four United games on an interim basis following the sacking of Erik ten Hag in October, winning three and drawing one of those games.

Two of those wins came against Leicester City, a 5-2 victory in the Carabao Cup and and 3-0 win in the [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league). The Foxes are now [one of the clubs linked with Van Nistelrooy](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruud-van-nistelrooy-man-united-30441773) after the sacking of Steve Cooper on Sunday afternoon.

### Brutal verdict on former Man Utd chief

Former Crystal Palace owner Simon Jordan has humorously suggested that having a background at [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) doesn't necessarily make new Rangers chief executive Patrick Stewart a good appointment. The Aberdeen-born ex Red Devils supremo spent almost two decades in various roles at [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford) before he recently left the English [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) giants.

Former lawyer Stewart first joined United as General Counsel and Company Secretary and had a stint as interim chief executive, a permanent position he will take up at Rangers when he starts his work at Ibrox on December 16.

The fact one of Britain's biggest clubs is on his CV makes him seem like a coup but in recent years Manchester United, similar to Rangers lately, have been criticised in terms of the running of the club and a far cry from the dominant days under Sir [Alex Ferguson](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/sir-alex-ferguson) and ex chairman Martin Edwards and chief executive David Gill.

17:52Isaac Seelochan

### Opinion: Amorim has proven United critic wrong

It has taken just 90 minutes for Ruben Amorim's style to be picked apart and rubbished. One unconvincing draw against an Ipswich side that has already taken points off Aston Villa and Tottenham this season is enough evidence to realise he is wasting his time.

[Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) set his side up in his preferred 3-4-3 system, just as he had said he would do, and that shape helped to deliver a wonderfully crafted first goal after just 81 seconds. The move went from back to front and involved excellent interchange and individual skill. It was an early example of what the 39-year-old wants to deliver.

But there's no doubt his team struggled to get to grips with the system at times. Is that a surprise? Not exactly. The full squad had just two training sessions to master not only Amorim's demands but his new system. A couple of weeks ago Matthijs de Ligt said playing in a back three wasn't notably different to a back four, but it does come with different ideas. ### Van Nistelrooy next job update

Ruud van Nistelrooy is reportedly set to become the new manager of 2. Bundesliga outfit Hamburg, according to Sky Sports Germany.

The 48-year-old has not been out of work long after leaving [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) earlier this month, having taken over the reigns at [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford) on an interim basis after [Erik ten Hag was sacked back in October.](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/breaking-manchester-united-sack-manager-30069556)

Former United forward [Van Nistelrooy](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruud-van-nistelrooy) re-joined the club in the summer to become Ten Hag's assistant, but was promoted to the top job following their 2-1 defeat at West Ham last month. Van Nistelrooy ended up winning three of his four matches in charge before Ruben Amorim's arrival.

Ruud van Nistelrooy Man United reunion chance emerges after huge announcement
=============================================================================

Former Manchester United striker and interim manager Ruud van Nistelrooy is the odds-on favourite with the bookies to become the next Leicester City manager.
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruud-van-nistelrooy-man-united-30441773#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

Kieran Horn

Joseph Chapman

*   05:30, 25 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Ruud van Nistelrooy speaks to Steve Cooper during Manchester United vs Leicester City](https://i2-prod.football.london/incoming/article30441798.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_Ruud-van-Nistelrooy.jpg)

Ruud van Nistelrooy could replace Steve Cooper at Leicester City (Image: (Photo by Michael Regan/Getty Images))

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Following the dismissal of Steve Cooper, former Manchester United interim head coach Ruud van Nistelrooy has swiftly emerged as the front-runner for the Leicester City managerial position. On Sunday, Leicester announced Cooper's departure from the King Power Stadium after securing only two victories in his 12-game tenure, with the club choosing to move forward following Saturday's loss to [Chelsea](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/chelsea-fc).

The incoming manager will take over a team currently positioned 16th in the [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) and without a win in four games. Van Nistelrooy, who recently enjoyed two triumphs over the Foxes during his temporary stint at the helm of United, is now tipped to replace Cooper.

[The Coventry City position, which remains vacant following the dismissal of Mark Robins, was one that Van Nistelrooy was reportedly considered for.](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruud-van-nistelrooy-next-job-30433486) Former Chelsea and Everton boss Frank Lampard was also in the frame for that role and now appears to be the frontrunner to take charge at the CBS Arena.

**READ MORE: [Manchester United player ratings as Andre Onana good but three get 4/10 vs Ipswich Town](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-player-ratings-andre-30440825)**

**READ MORE: [Roy Keane asks Ruben Amorim to change one thing after 45 minutes as Man United manager](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/roy-keane-asks-ruben-amorim-30441479)**

It's since been suggested that United legend Van Nistelrooy has been waiting for a chance to manage a top-flight team, with several managers, including those at Crystal Palace, Wolves and Southampton, under severe pressure.

Therefore, it's likely that Van Nistelrooy will stay in England and aim to return to a full managerial role, making him a possible contender should City consider replacing Cooper with the Dutchman. Van Nistelrooy could reunite with United in March, with Leicester hosting the Reds on the 15th of that month.

However, a return to former club Hamburger SV could also be on the table. According to Sky Sports Germany, Van Nistelrooy is on the list of possible replacements for Steffen Baumgart at the Bundesliga 2 club and has already been discussed internally. Following his departure from [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford), Ruben Amorim has been appointed the club's new head coach.

His first game in charge arrived this past Sunday with a 1-1 Premier League draw played out against Ipswich Town at Portman Road.

============================================================================

Jose Mourinho has revealed whether or not he's planning to bring [Cristiano Ronaldo](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/cristiano-ronaldo) to Fenerbahçe. The 39-year-old striker faces an increasingly uncertain future in the Middle East, with [his contract at Al-Nassr set to expire at the end of the season](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/sergio-aguero-makes-man-united-30445126).

Ronaldo, who was released by [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) back in November 2022, has featured 10 times in the Saudi Pro League this season, scoring 10 goals and providing two assists. Playing a key role in Stefano Pioli's side, [the Portugal international has fired Al-Nassr to third in the table](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-star-reveals-four-30441792).

Despite his impressive performances, he's yet to be awarded an extension, making him available on a free transfer in the summer. According to Turkish outlet [Fotomac](https://www.fotomac.com.tr/fenerbahce/2024/11/21/fenerbahceden-dunyayi-sarsacak-ronaldo-hamlesi-iste-cilgin-plan?paging=10) last week, [Mourinho contacted Ronaldo about a potential move to Fenerbahçe](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-new-contender-key-30444877).

**READ MORE:** [**'Stuck' - Amorim reveals the new instructions United players have**](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/stuck-ruben-amorim-explains-what-30441804)

**READ MORE:** [**Amad improved something in only three days of training under Amorim**](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruben-amorim-reveals-what-amad-30441823)

The report claimed that the Turkish side's director of football, Mario Branco, opened talks with the Portuguese talisman and his agent, Jorge Mendes. Speaking to reporters at the weekend, the former United boss was quizzed on the reports – which he described as 'ridiculous'.

"News about Cristiano Ronaldo to Fenerbahce are ridiculous," said Mourinho, who preceded to make his fellow countryman an offer. "Cristiano might come to Istanbul to eat because it's right in the middle of the road between Saudi and Portugal. Or maybe he'll come see his old friend Jose, we can eat at my hotel."

From January, foreign clubs will be eligible to open pre-contract talks with Ronaldo over a free transfer in the summer – unless he signs a new deal beforehand. If the United legend doesn't pen an extension, the Saudi Pro League outfit will be forced to make a difficult call.

Al-Nassr will have to consider whether they'd rather risk losing Ronaldo for free or cut their losses and cash in during the upcoming transfer window. While the five-time Ballon d'Or winner have been linked with a move, he's recently suggested that he could soon hang up his boots.

Speaking to reporters after Portugal's 5-1 win over Poland, as quoted by [TNT Sports](https://www.tntsports.co.uk/football/uefa-nations-league/2024-2025/cristiano-ronaldo-retirement-dismisses-coaching-management-portugal-al-nassr-bicycle-kick_sto20054667/story.shtml), Ronaldo said: "Plan for retirement? If it has to happen, in one or two years. I don't know. I'm turning 40 soon. I really want to enjoy \[it\], as long as I feel motivated, I keep going.

"The day I don't feel motivated, I will retire. I don't see myself managing a team; that's not in my plans. My future lies in other areas outside of football, although time will tell what happens."

Mourinho managed Ronaldo at Real Madrid between 2010 and 2013. They won the LaLiga title in 2011-12 and the Copa del Rey the year before.

data: {"title":"Portuguese media make their feelings clear on Man Utd after Ruben Amorim held to draw in first match","description":"Portuguese media have spoken out after Ruben Amorim's first match as Manchester United manager against Ipswich Town.","url":"https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/man-utd/ruben-amorim-ipswich-town-portugal-media-reacts-092422-20241125","content":"Portuguese media make their feelings clear on Man Utd after Ruben Amorim held to draw in first match - Man Utd - SPORTbible
===============

To make sure you never miss out on your favourite **NEW stories**, we're happy to send you some reminders

Click '**OK**' then '**Allow**' to enable notifications

Not nowOK

**Portuguese media have had their say on Ruben Amorim following his first game in charge of new club Manchester United.**

After an exciting 3-2 [match between Liverpool and Southampton on Sunday](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/liverpool/liverpool-southampton-arne-slot-336586-20241124), all all eyes turned to the Portman Road Stadium as [Ipswich Town](https://www.sportbible.com/ipswich-town) welcomed [Amorim](https://www.sportbible.com/ruben-amorim) to England [for his first game as United manager.](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/man-utd/ruben-amorim-joshua-zirkzee-man-united-ipswich-026294-20241125)

[Despite an early goal from Marcus Rashford](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/man-utd/ruben-amorim-man-utd-marcus-rashford-goal-ipswich-559633-20241124), [United](https://www.sportbible.com/manchester-united) allowed the hosts back into the game as Omari Hutchinson scored an equaliser that set the final scoreline as 1-1.

Advert

And in the wake of the match, members of the Portuguese media have spoken out about former Sporting manager Amorim's first match in charge of United.

Portuguese outlet Record was not impressed with what they say from Amorim's side on Sunday suggesting that, while two players enjoyed standout performances, Amorim has a lot that he needs to improve at United.

Their report [stated](https://www.record.pt/jogos-em-direto/live/146800): "The goal after just 2 minutes suggested a great performance from Manchester United in Ruben Amorim's debut, but it was short-lived.

Advert

"Rashford scored after a great play by Diallo, but the Red Devils, in short, put in a somewhat lacklustre performance against an Ipswich side that was better at various points in the game.

"Onana shone on two occasions in the United goal and Bruno Fernandes was the most clear-cut, but Amorim's team struggled to connect the game and lacked intensity.

"Ultimately, the Portuguese coach has a lot of work ahead of him."

Sports newspaper A Bola agreed with Record's assessment and were highly critical of United's performance, criticising their lack of speed and unity.

Advert

![Image 1: Ruben Amorim's first match as Manchester United manager ended as a 1-1 draw with Ipswich Town. (Image: Getty) ](https://images.ladbible.com/resize?type=webp&quality=70&width=3840&fit=contain&gravity=auto&url=https://images.ladbiblegroup.com/v3/assets/blta90d05ad41a54a71/bltf29b28a58f371f13/674495fef32005d7356c8a6e/GettyImages-2186663264.jpg)

Ruben Amorim's first match as Manchester United manager ended as a 1-1 draw with Ipswich Town. (Image: Getty)

They [reported](https://www.abola.pt/futebol/noticias/so-80-segundos-a-amorim-que-o-resto-ainda-foi-a-ten-hag-2024112418431377949): "The first goal of the Amorim era for the Red Devils came just 80 seconds into the game.

"The worst came later: a shapeless team, slow defence, low pace and rare dangerous chances up front, showing that there is still a lot of work ahead for the Portuguese coach."

Amorim's next match in the United dugout will be his first at Old Trafford as his side hosts Norwegian club Bodø/Glimt for a [Europa League](https://www.sportbible.com/europa-league) clash on Thursday night.

Advert

United will then play seven Premier League fixtures in December as part of a busy festive period, the first of which is a home fixture against Everton.

**New footage has emerged showing exactly what Liverpool defender Virgil van Dijk did when he saw Mo Salah speaking to the media.**

[Salah](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/liverpool/mo-salah-transfer-news-contract-update-major-frontrunners-079380-20241125), 32, scored twice in the 3-2 victory at St Mary’s as the Reds went eight points clear of [Manchester City](https://www.sportbible.com/manchester-city) at the top of the Premier League.

The brace took his tally to ten goals and six assists in just twelve league games this term.

But it was [Salah’s post-match comments](https://www.sportbible.com/football/football-news/liverpool/mo-salah-contract-negotiations-207279-20241125) that hit the headlines following the result.

The forward admitted that he was “probably more out than in” when discussing whether he had been offered a new contract by the club.

Eden Hazard asked if he or Mo Salah is the better player

The latter of the trio, who featured against his former side on Sunday, could not help but react when he saw Salah speaking to the media scrum outside the Players Entrance at St Mary’s.

"You know I have been in the club for many years. There is no club like this. But in the end it is not in my hands. As I said, it is December and I haven't received anything yet about my future.

"I love the fans. The fans love me. In the end it is not in my hands or the fans' hands."

The Egyptian winger was then asked by reporters if he was disappointed about the current situation, he confessed: "Of course, yeah. I'm not going to retire soon so I'm just playing, focusing on the season and I'm trying to win the Premier League and hopefully the Champions League as well.

"I'm disappointed but we will see.

"I am very professional. Everybody can see my work ethic. I'm just trying to enjoy my football and I will play at the top level as long as possible."

Not nowOK

**Former Manchester United midfielder Owen Hargreaves has revealed that new manager Ruben Amorim was not happy with three players on the touchline during his side's 1-1 draw with Ipswich Town.**

Amorim was standing in the dugout for the first time as [United](https://www.sportbible.com/manchester-united) manager at Portman Road, and saw his side get off to the ideal start as they went 1-0 up in 80 seconds through Marcus Rashford.

While certain aspects will have pleased [Amorim](https://www.sportbible.com/ruben-amorim), such as the performances of Amad Diallo and Andre Onana, other parts of the display will no doubt be familiar after the hours of match analysis the 39-year-old will have done in recent weeks.

Manchester United have a new contender for key Ruben Amorim role after tactical switch at Ipswich
=================================================================================================

Man United have a new contender for key Ruben Amorim role after tactical switch
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   11:30, 25 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 2: Bruno Fernandes](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/article30444931.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2185817041.jpg)

Bruno Fernandes best moments for United at Ipswich came in a deeper role

![Image 3: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

This wasn't the lift-off for the Ruben Amorim era Manchester United had hoped for, but the mitigation for a sometimes disjointed performance is pretty strong.

[Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) introduced a new formation after two training sessions with his full squad and attempted to up the intensity with a group of players who don't yet have the physical capabilities to sustain it for 90 minutes.

He was also trying to do all of that against a team superbly well-drilled by Kieran McKenna and one that is proving difficult to beat this season. Ipswich have now taken points off Brighton, Aston Villa, Tottenham, and United this season.

The brilliant first goal of the Amorim era after 81 seconds was both a sensational start and a high point. [United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) finished the game strongly, but in between, they were pegged back for large periods and needed Andre Onana at his brilliant best to keep hold of a point.

**ALSO READ: [Ruben Amorim is working on United's three weaknesses with new warm-up drills](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/ruben-amorim-working-manchester-uniteds-30442813)**

**ALSO READ: [Amorim reveals what Amad improved in only three days of a training at United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruben-amorim-reveals-what-amad-30441823)**

Amorim cut a frustrated figure on the touchline, but he was also proactive in trying to tilt the game back United's way. There was a double substitution after 56 minutes and another 12 minutes later when Rasmus Hojlund and Joshua Zirkzee were introduced together.

That change saw Hojlund replace Marcus Rashford as the focal point of the attack, while Zirkzee took the position [Fernandes](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/bruno-fernandes) had been playing as the right-sided No. 10. Fernandes dropped back to a deeper midfield role, which resulted in what was probably his best spell in the game.

This was a disappointing afternoon for Fernandes, with his revival under Ruud van Nistelrooy quickly petering out under his countryman. But collecting the ball in that deeper role, closer to Manuel Ugarte, he did display an excellent range of passing and helped United sustain attacks for longer than they had managed in the first three quarters of the game.

It might be that the state of the game helped Fernandes. Ipswich were getting tired by this point, and the captain appeared well-suited to exposing them. Whether it would work playing him deeper from the start is another question, and Amorim summed up the dilemma when speaking to Sky Sports after the game.

"He improved his game by playing near the ball, so he can give us the long pass, but you cannot put him there all the time because he wants the long pass all the time."

Maybe that hints at Fernandes being an option to drop deeper later in games when United are chasing goals. Amorim isn't the first United coach to find the best way to use the 30-year-old, who is both the team's most creative player and the player most likely to turn over possession.

He was neater on the ball on Sunday, completing 92% of his passes, a season-high tally by some distance. Many of those were from that advanced position, and it was noticeable that when he dropped deeper, he looked to utilise his ability to play long passes over the top, trying to get United's forwards running against Ipswich's defenders.

Fernandes made his United debut in a deep midfield role in Ole Gunnar Solskjaer's 4-2-3-1, but has barely ventured that far back since emerging as the creative fulcrum of a side lacking goals. This display was a reminder that he can do it, and he plays as more of a No. 8 for Portugal.

The difficult task for Amorim is fitting everyone in. Casemiro and Christian Eriksen started in those positions, but Manuel Ugarte will likely make one his own and Kobbie Mainoo the other. There are options for the No. 10 positions as well. Fernandes started next to Alejandro Garnacho, but Amorim could be tempted to give Mason Mount games there when his match fitness has improved.

That makes Fernandes' versatility a key weapon. There will be games where Amorim sees him as a more helpful option deeper, or even moments in games when the switch can be made. If he can coach out that tendency to look for the long pass every time, he could become even better at controlling the game.

Amorim will be looking for that. The midfield combinations, like the rest of the team, will take time to gel under the new head coach, but Fernandes has given him something to think about.

data: {"title":"Man United have a new contender for key Ruben Amorim role after tactical switch","description":"Man United have a new contender for key Ruben Amorim role after tactical switch","url":"https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-new-contender-key-30444877","content":"Manchester United have a new contender for key Ruben Amorim role after tactical switch at Ipswich - Tyrone Marshall - Manchester Evening News
===============
                                  

 

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)opinion

Manchester United have a new contender for key Ruben Amorim role after tactical switch at Ipswich
=================================================================================================

Man United have a new contender for key Ruben Amorim role after tactical switch
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-new-contender-key-30444877#comments-wrapper "Comments")

![Image 1: Tyrone Marshall](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article15426084.ece/ALTERNATES/s98/0_tyrone-marshall.jpg)

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)opinion

By

[Tyrone Marshall](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/tyrone-marshall/)Senior Football Writer

*   11:30, 25 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 2: Bruno Fernandes](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/article30444931.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2185817041.jpg)

Bruno Fernandes best moments for United at Ipswich came in a deeper role

![Image 3: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

This wasn't the lift-off for the Ruben Amorim era Manchester United had hoped for, but the mitigation for a sometimes disjointed performance is pretty strong.

[Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) introduced a new formation after two training sessions with his full squad and attempted to up the intensity with a group of players who don't yet have the physical capabilities to sustain it for 90 minutes.

He was also trying to do all of that against a team superbly well-drilled by Kieran McKenna and one that is proving difficult to beat this season. Ipswich have now taken points off Brighton, Aston Villa, Tottenham, and United this season.

The brilliant first goal of the Amorim era after 81 seconds was both a sensational start and a high point. [United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) finished the game strongly, but in between, they were pegged back for large periods and needed Andre Onana at his brilliant best to keep hold of a point.

**ALSO READ: [Ruben Amorim is working on United's three weaknesses with new warm-up drills](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/ruben-amorim-working-manchester-uniteds-30442813)**

**ALSO READ: [Amorim reveals what Amad improved in only three days of a training at United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruben-amorim-reveals-what-amad-30441823)**

Amorim cut a frustrated figure on the touchline, but he was also proactive in trying to tilt the game back United's way. There was a double substitution after 56 minutes and another 12 minutes later when Rasmus Hojlund and Joshua Zirkzee were introduced together.

That change saw Hojlund replace Marcus Rashford as the focal point of the attack, while Zirkzee took the position [Fernandes](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/bruno-fernandes) had been playing as the right-sided No. 10. Fernandes dropped back to a deeper midfield role, which resulted in what was probably his best spell in the game.

This was a disappointing afternoon for Fernandes, with his revival under Ruud van Nistelrooy quickly petering out under his countryman. But collecting the ball in that deeper role, closer to Manuel Ugarte, he did display an excellent range of passing and helped United sustain attacks for longer than they had managed in the first three quarters of the game.

It might be that the state of the game helped Fernandes. Ipswich were getting tired by this point, and the captain appeared well-suited to exposing them. Whether it would work playing him deeper from the start is another question, and Amorim summed up the dilemma when speaking to Sky Sports after the game.

"He improved his game by playing near the ball, so he can give us the long pass, but you cannot put him there all the time because he wants the long pass all the time."

Maybe that hints at Fernandes being an option to drop deeper later in games when United are chasing goals. Amorim isn't the first United coach to find the best way to use the 30-year-old, who is both the team's most creative player and the player most likely to turn over possession.

He was neater on the ball on Sunday, completing 92% of his passes, a season-high tally by some distance. Many of those were from that advanced position, and it was noticeable that when he dropped deeper, he looked to utilise his ability to play long passes over the top, trying to get United's forwards running against Ipswich's defenders.

Fernandes made his United debut in a deep midfield role in Ole Gunnar Solskjaer's 4-2-3-1, but has barely ventured that far back since emerging as the creative fulcrum of a side lacking goals. This display was a reminder that he can do it, and he plays as more of a No. 8 for Portugal.

The difficult task for Amorim is fitting everyone in. Casemiro and Christian Eriksen started in those positions, but Manuel Ugarte will likely make one his own and Kobbie Mainoo the other. There are options for the No. 10 positions as well. Fernandes started next to Alejandro Garnacho, but Amorim could be tempted to give Mason Mount games there when his match fitness has improved.

That makes Fernandes' versatility a key weapon. There will be games where Amorim sees him as a more helpful option deeper, or even moments in games when the switch can be made. If he can coach out that tendency to look for the long pass every time, he could become even better at controlling the game.

Amorim will be looking for that. The midfield combinations, like the rest of the team, will take time to gel under the new head coach, but Fernandes has given him something to think about.

Manchester United have a new contender for key Ruben Amorim role after tactical switch at Ipswich
=================================================================================================

Man United have a new contender for key Ruben Amorim role after tactical switch
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 2: Bruno Fernandes](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/article30444931.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2185817041.jpg)

Bruno Fernandes best moments for United at Ipswich came in a deeper role

![Image 3: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

This wasn't the lift-off for the Ruben Amorim era Manchester United had hoped for, but the mitigation for a sometimes disjointed performance is pretty strong.

[Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) introduced a new formation after two training sessions with his full squad and attempted to up the intensity with a group of players who don't yet have the physical capabilities to sustain it for 90 minutes.

He was also trying to do all of that against a team superbly well-drilled by Kieran McKenna and one that is proving difficult to beat this season. Ipswich have now taken points off Brighton, Aston Villa, Tottenham, and United this season.

The brilliant first goal of the Amorim era after 81 seconds was both a sensational start and a high point. [United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) finished the game strongly, but in between, they were pegged back for large periods and needed Andre Onana at his brilliant best to keep hold of a point.

**ALSO READ: [Ruben Amorim is working on United's three weaknesses with new warm-up drills](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/ruben-amorim-working-manchester-uniteds-30442813)**

**ALSO READ: [Amorim reveals what Amad improved in only three days of a training at United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruben-amorim-reveals-what-amad-30441823)**

Amorim cut a frustrated figure on the touchline, but he was also proactive in trying to tilt the game back United's way. There was a double substitution after 56 minutes and another 12 minutes later when Rasmus Hojlund and Joshua Zirkzee were introduced together.

That change saw Hojlund replace Marcus Rashford as the focal point of the attack, while Zirkzee took the position [Fernandes](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/bruno-fernandes) had been playing as the right-sided No. 10. Fernandes dropped back to a deeper midfield role, which resulted in what was probably his best spell in the game.

This was a disappointing afternoon for Fernandes, with his revival under Ruud van Nistelrooy quickly petering out under his countryman. But collecting the ball in that deeper role, closer to Manuel Ugarte, he did display an excellent range of passing and helped United sustain attacks for longer than they had managed in the first three quarters of the game.

It might be that the state of the game helped Fernandes. Ipswich were getting tired by this point, and the captain appeared well-suited to exposing them. Whether it would work playing him deeper from the start is another question, and Amorim summed up the dilemma when speaking to Sky Sports after the game.

"He improved his game by playing near the ball, so he can give us the long pass, but you cannot put him there all the time because he wants the long pass all the time."

Maybe that hints at Fernandes being an option to drop deeper later in games when United are chasing goals. Amorim isn't the first United coach to find the best way to use the 30-year-old, who is both the team's most creative player and the player most likely to turn over possession.

He was neater on the ball on Sunday, completing 92% of his passes, a season-high tally by some distance. Many of those were from that advanced position, and it was noticeable that when he dropped deeper, he looked to utilise his ability to play long passes over the top, trying to get United's forwards running against Ipswich's defenders.

Fernandes made his United debut in a deep midfield role in Ole Gunnar Solskjaer's 4-2-3-1, but has barely ventured that far back since emerging as the creative fulcrum of a side lacking goals. This display was a reminder that he can do it, and he plays as more of a No. 8 for Portugal.

The difficult task for Amorim is fitting everyone in. Casemiro and Christian Eriksen started in those positions, but Manuel Ugarte will likely make one his own and Kobbie Mainoo the other. There are options for the No. 10 positions as well. Fernandes started next to Alejandro Garnacho, but Amorim could be tempted to give Mason Mount games there when his match fitness has improved.

That makes Fernandes' versatility a key weapon. There will be games where Amorim sees him as a more helpful option deeper, or even moments in games when the switch can be made. If he can coach out that tendency to look for the long pass every time, he could become even better at controlling the game.

Amorim will be looking for that. The midfield combinations, like the rest of the team, will take time to gel under the new head coach, but Fernandes has given him something to think about.

===============

Manchester United have a new contender for key Ruben Amorim role after tactical switch at Ipswich
=================================================================================================

Man United have a new contender for key Ruben Amorim role after tactical switch
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-new-contender-key-30444877#comments-wrapper "Comments")

![Image 1: Tyrone Marshall](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article15426084.ece/ALTERNATES/s98/0_tyrone-marshall.jpg)

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)opinion

By

[Tyrone Marshall](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/tyrone-marshall/)Senior Football Writer

*   11:30, 25 NOV 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 2: Bruno Fernandes](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/article30444931.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2185817041.jpg)

Bruno Fernandes best moments for United at Ipswich came in a deeper role

![Image 3: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

This wasn't the lift-off for the Ruben Amorim era Manchester United had hoped for, but the mitigation for a sometimes disjointed performance is pretty strong.

[Amorim](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/ruben-amorim) introduced a new formation after two training sessions with his full squad and attempted to up the intensity with a group of players who don't yet have the physical capabilities to sustain it for 90 minutes.

He was also trying to do all of that against a team superbly well-drilled by Kieran McKenna and one that is proving difficult to beat this season. Ipswich have now taken points off Brighton, Aston Villa, Tottenham, and United this season.

The brilliant first goal of the Amorim era after 81 seconds was both a sensational start and a high point. [United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) finished the game strongly, but in between, they were pegged back for large periods and needed Andre Onana at his brilliant best to keep hold of a point.

**ALSO READ: [Ruben Amorim is working on United's three weaknesses with new warm-up drills](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/ruben-amorim-working-manchester-uniteds-30442813)**

**ALSO READ: [Amorim reveals what Amad improved in only three days of a training at United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/ruben-amorim-reveals-what-amad-30441823)**

Amorim cut a frustrated figure on the touchline, but he was also proactive in trying to tilt the game back United's way. There was a double substitution after 56 minutes and another 12 minutes later when Rasmus Hojlund and Joshua Zirkzee were introduced together.

That change saw Hojlund replace Marcus Rashford as the focal point of the attack, while Zirkzee took the position [Fernandes](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/bruno-fernandes) had been playing as the right-sided No. 10. Fernandes dropped back to a deeper midfield role, which resulted in what was probably his best spell in the game.

This was a disappointing afternoon for Fernandes, with his revival under Ruud van Nistelrooy quickly petering out under his countryman. But collecting the ball in that deeper role, closer to Manuel Ugarte, he did display an excellent range of passing and helped United sustain attacks for longer than they had managed in the first three quarters of the game.

It might be that the state of the game helped Fernandes. Ipswich were getting tired by this point, and the captain appeared well-suited to exposing them. Whether it would work playing him deeper from the start is another question, and Amorim summed up the dilemma when speaking to Sky Sports after the game.

"He improved his game by playing near the ball, so he can give us the long pass, but you cannot put him there all the time because he wants the long pass all the time."

Maybe that hints at Fernandes being an option to drop deeper later in games when United are chasing goals. Amorim isn't the first United coach to find the best way to use the 30-year-old, who is both the team's most creative player and the player most likely to turn over possession.

He was neater on the ball on Sunday, completing 92% of his passes, a season-high tally by some distance. Many of those were from that advanced position, and it was noticeable that when he dropped deeper, he looked to utilise his ability to play long passes over the top, trying to get United's forwards running against Ipswich's defenders.

Fernandes made his United debut in a deep midfield role in Ole Gunnar Solskjaer's 4-2-3-1, but has barely ventured that far back since emerging as the creative fulcrum of a side lacking goals. This display was a reminder that he can do it, and he plays as more of a No. 8 for Portugal.

The difficult task for Amorim is fitting everyone in. Casemiro and Christian Eriksen started in those positions, but Manuel Ugarte will likely make one his own and Kobbie Mainoo the other. There are options for the No. 10 positions as well. Fernandes started next to Alejandro Garnacho, but Amorim could be tempted to give Mason Mount games there when his match fitness has improved.

That makes Fernandes' versatility a key weapon. There will be games where Amorim sees him as a more helpful option deeper, or even moments in games when the switch can be made. If he can coach out that tendency to look for the long pass every time, he could become even better at controlling the game.

Amorim will be looking for that. The midfield combinations, like the rest of the team, will take time to gel under the new head coach, but Fernandes has given him something to think about.

====================================================================================

Robbie Savage has called on Ruben Amorim to reposition Alejandro Garnacho as wing-back in his new-look [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) side.

Garnacho was named as one of two attacking midfielders in Sunday's 1-1 draw with Ipswich Town at Portman Road, in what was a change to the wide right and left positions he had become accustomed to under Erik ten Hag.

However, Savage believes the 20-year-old would be better suited to one of the wingback roles in the 3-4-2-1 system the Portuguese tactician is trying to implement at [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford).

**ALSO READ: [United have a new contender for key Amorim role after tactical switch](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-new-contender-key-30444877)**

**ALSO READ: [Amorim is working on United's three weaknesses with new warm-up drills](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/ruben-amorim-working-manchester-uniteds-30442813)**

Speaking on BBC Radio 5 Live on Sunday, Savage said: "I don’t think Ruben Amorim’s system suits Alejandro Garnacho. He was used as one of the number tens. I think he is better as one of the wing-backs."

Since debuting for the first team in April 2022, Garnacho has made 105 appearances for the Reds and established himself as a key player under Ten Hag prior to the Dutchman's sacking.

United had given Amorim the dream start to his managerial career in the [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) as Marcus Rashford opened the scoring after less than two minutes.

However, the Reds were pegged back midway through the first half when Omari Hutchinson's curling effort beat Andre Onana from range.

Speaking after the game, Amorim said: "They were trying, they were thinking too much during the game and that is normal. We start very well but then we should have more possession with the ball, kept the ball and sometimes we had the ball in defence and the rest of the guys were too stuck because they were thinking, 'where should I be?'

"So this is the first point, when we make a new structure and you are so clear on that, they need time to have some fluidity in the game and I felt that. But it’s two games and I felt they did okay.

"What I understood today is they are trying, they are really trying, they stay in the positions, they receive the information and they try to use it in the game, that is very important. Even in the difficult moments I felt they were doing the things we wanted them to do.

"I know it’s frustrating for the fans but we are changing so much in this moment with a lot of games. We are going to suffer for a long period and we will try to win games, this will take time. We have to win games but we could lose if it was not for Onana. So I think we have to understand that and think and be pragmatic that these guys had two days to train to change so much."
